{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of fever, rash, conjunctival injection, erythema of the tongue and lips, and lymphadenopathy are suggestive of Kawasaki disease. This is a vasculitis that primarily affects children and can lead to complications involving the cardiovascular system. The most common complication of Kawasaki disease is coronary artery aneurysm.", "answer_choice": "A. Coronary artery aneurysm"}
